tool_description: Computes comprehensive risk metrics including volatility, Value at Risk (VaR), maximum drawdown, and other downside risk measures for portfolio analysis.

confidence_level.description: Confidence level for VaR calculation (between 0.90 and 0.99)

var_method.description: VaR calculation method: historical, parametric, monte_carlo

risk_free_rate.description: Risk-free rate for downside risk calculations (annualized)

target_return.description: Target return for downside deviation calculation

rolling_window.description: Window size for rolling risk metrics (minimum 5)

error_messages: Insufficient return data: At least 10 return observations required for meaningful risk calculations.
Invalid confidence level: confidence_level must be between 0.90 and 0.99.
Invalid VaR method: Use historical, parametric, or monte_carlo.
Invalid rolling window: rolling_window must be at least 5 and less than total return observations.
Risk-free rate error: risk_free_rate must be a valid positive or negative number.
Target return error: target_return must be a valid number.
usage: Provide returns array and optionally configure risk parameters. The tool calculates various risk metrics including VaR, volatility, and drawdown measures.

volatility.description: Standard deviation of returns (annualized if specified)

value_at_risk.description: Value at Risk at specified confidence level

downside_deviation.description: Volatility of negative returns relative to target
